thread.title: Car was snatched for executing robbery: Police
thread.title_full: Car was snatched for executing robbery: Police

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Car was snatched for executing robbery: Police
text:
Tribune News Service
Mohali, October 17
The kingpin of the gang, involved in the carjacking from Phase VII, here, confessed that the Verna car was snatched for the purpose of executing a gold robbery and brutally thrashing a rival criminal, who had recently come out of the Barnala Jail on bail. The Mohali Senior Superintendent of Police, Gurpreet Singh Bhullar, said the kingpin, Yuvraj, alias Fateh, confessed that one of his accomplices, Jagsir Singh, alias Giani, from Sanghera village (Barnala) had asked him to teach a lesson to his rival Baljodh Singh from Alipur village (Sangrur), who had recently come out of the Branala Jail. Giani is still lodged in the jail. “During the interrogation, Fateh confessed that he along with another accomplice, identified as Mani Tibba, had planned to rob gold from a trader on the Ambala-Rajpura road. The trader’s driver is an accomplice of Tibba, who is currently lodged in the Patiala Jail. For the robbery, Fateh needed a car so they snatched the Verna car”, said the SSP. The SSP further said that Fateh was booked for the first time at the age of 17. Then Chandigarh Police had registered a case under Section 365 of the IPC against him. “Now more than 10 cases, including four attempt to murder cases, had been registered against him at various police stations. Today, Fateh was presented before the court and was sent to a three-day police remand by the court.
